title: Cannot start a game
body:
Hello, I have lately been experiencing some problems with my computer. It all started one game in League where everything was running smoothly as usual until the screen just frooze in the middle of a game and a constant, painfull sound came out of my speakers. I couldn't do anything and had to shut down the computer. Then I started it up again and same thing would happen again. After that I stopped playing for a couple of weeks and focused on school, but then when I tried it again I couldn't even start a game. That is where I am today. A message pops up where it says: "An unknown DirectX error has occurred and League of Legends cannot start. Please make sure your video card is using the latest video drivers from the manufacturer."

Everytime I leave champ select this pops up. What should I do?

replies.body:
I can understand why you would be so worrisome. I wouldn't want painful sounds coming out of my speakers either! D:

The "unknown DirectX" pop up makes me instantly think something is going on with that. We have a [DirectX step](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974#wq3) in our Bug Splat and Game Crash guide that can help with that. 

If that doesn't work, it still sounds like something might be up with your hardware. The rest of the [Crash Guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974) has some great steps to run through on fixing this issue.

If none of those steps work, our Tech team can provide further support in [a ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new). Hopefully these suggestions helped you out!
